intro: Kyrsteniopsis, commonly known as the false broomrape, is a genus of flowering plants in the Orobanchaceae family. These plants are hemiparasitic, meaning they partially rely on host plants for water and nutrients while performing photosynthesis. They are characterized by their lack of chlorophyll, which results in a pale or yellowish appearance. Kyrsteniopsis species typically have small, lance-shaped leaves and produce clusters of small, white or greenish flowers. They are often found in arid or semi-arid regions, growing in association with various host plants.
